thread.title: U.S. Risers/Fallers: Amazon Royal Caribbean VeriFone Systems Gap BlackBerry Netflix
thread.title_full: U.S. Risers/Fallers: Amazon Royal Caribbean VeriFone Systems Gap BlackBerry Netflix | MENAFN.COM

author: ProactiveInvestors  N.America
title: U.S. Risers/Fallers: Amazon Royal Caribbean VeriFone Systems Gap BlackBerry Netflix
text:
(MENAFN - ProactiveInvestors) Below are the main news driven share price changes at 2:03 p.m. in New York on Friday: FALLERS 
Blackberry  (NASDAQ:BBRY) fell 1.1% to 7.39 erasing an earlier gain. The Canadian smartphone maker agreed to buy its rival mobile security software maker Good Technology for 425mln in cash.
VeriFone Systems ( NYSE:PAY ) fell 1.7% to 30.51 after the provider of in secure electronic payment solutions guided for downbeat current-quarter revenue and earnings as it continues to make the turn from mostly shipping terminals to delivering fully integrated solutions.
Amazon.com ( NASDAQ:AMZN ) slumped 1.5% to 497.35 after the online retail giant said its cloud-computing unit Amazon Web Services (AWS) agreed to acquire video-encoding company Elemental Technologies for an undisclosed amount.
Netflix ( NASDAQ:NFLX ) fell 3.1% to 97.88 heading for a 6th straight loss even as Cantor Fitzgerald reiterated its ‘buy’ rating on the video-streaming company.
Gap ( NYSE:GPS ) surrendered 2% to 32.32 after the apparel retailer posted a 2% decline in same-store sales for August across its brands but Old Navy sales rose by 6 percent
Royal Caribbean (NYSE:RCL) dropped 1.5% to 87.95 even as the cruise operator hiked its dividend by 25% to about 0.38 per share on Thursday.
